para.text: When saving the document as SVG, you may want to follow a naming convention that simplifies the file's use by Walls. I normally include something like "_ai11" in the name to indicate what program produced the file. When the SVG export dialog is opened in Walls, the field containing the pathname of the merged file is initialized in one of two ways. If an SVG file is
to the reviewed item (at any sublevel, but with an assigned type of
), its pathname is used. Otherwise, the path is the
and the file name is the item's base name with suffix "_mrg.svg" appended. The default
file name, on the other hand, is constructed by appending "_w2d.svgz" to the base name. Of course you can change names while in the dialog.
